title: Could it be Helvetica Rounded?
content:
Hi,

I’ve posted this before, and got the answer that it could be squooshed Helvetica Rounded, and it possibly is. HOWEVER, I Can only find Helvetica Rounded Bold which seems far to bold and thick. the typeface looks just like it, but it’s so fat, when in the logo every trace is so nicely thin. Incredibly, I have the same problem (only black and bold versions available) for several similar rounded fonts. Is there an Helvetica rounded (thin or light) not so fat? where?  
Is there any good alternative (rounded thin) that looks just like Helvetica?  
Thanks.  
Pedro

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090403080112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_3551.jpg)

 [‹ Help our studio identify this bold serif.](http://web.archive.org/web/20090403080112/http:/typophile.com/node/56530 "Go to previous forum topic") [Beautiful Serif - Any ideas? I can't find anything as clean? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20090403080112/http:/typophile.com/node/56526 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pedromi

Hi,

Thank you for the forum usage tips, honestly! I’m new to forums.  
By the way can you tell me how to bump the thread?

Thanks.  
Pedro

Hi all,

Any ideas / suggestions regarding my initial post would be very much appreciated (I’m desperate).  
This is my own logo (done by someoen else) and now I’m stuck.  
Thanks
